Name: Dan Strauss
Summary: Dan Strauss has worked for Councilmember Sally Bagshaw, the Alliance for Gun Responsibility and state Sen. David Frockt.
Problem: The city and county need to regionally address homelessness in coordination with the state.
Endorsements: Councilmember Sally Bagshaw and Snohomish County Executive Dave Somers are early endorsers

Name: Ed Pottharst
Summary: Ed Pottharst is a Seattle Parks and Recreation planner who previously spent many years with the Department of Neighborhoods. He once served as Phinney Neighborhood Association board president.
Occupation: Planner for Seattle Parks and Recreation

Name: Heidi Wills
Summary: Heidi Wills was a council member from 1999 to 2003. She's run a nonprofit that uses golf to help young people.
Endorsements: Hilary Franz-WA State Lands Commissioner, Peter Steinbrueck- Port Commissioner, Javier Valdez- St. Rep., 46th District , Gary Locke-Former WA State Governor, Charles Royer- Former Seattle Mayor, Ron Sims- Former King County Executive, Judy Nicastro- Former Seattle City Councilmember

Name: Jay Fathi
Summary: Jay Fathi is a doctor who has specialized in community-based care. As leader of a start-up statewide health-insurance plan, he helped 250,000 people get coverage, though he was ultimately let go.
Problem: We need less divisiveness and more collaboration to solve our city's challenges and deliver on our values.

Name: Jeremy Cook
Summary: Jeremy Cook is a North Ballard resident and graphic designer who believes drug addiction is the most important problem facing Seattle.
Committee: Housing, Health, Energy and Workers’ Rights

Name: Joey Massa
Summary: Joey Massa is a Washington Army National Guard veteran whose father is the mayor of a small town in Eastern Washington.
Rent: My wife and I own our boat and rent our slip.
Committee: Housing, Health, Energy and Workers' Rights
Problem: A lack of data-driven, solution-oriented policy

Name: John Peeples
Summary: John Peeples is a Green Lake resident and an advocate for smaller government. He ran unsuccessfully for a state House seat in 2018 as a Republican.
Problem: Homelessness and its related problems of addiction and crime, and the City Council's refusal to end the problem

Name: Jon Lisbin
Summary: Jon Lisbin is the president of Seattle Fair Growth and helped challenge the city's recent neighborhood-upzone plan.
Problem: Lack of true community engagement, which has derailed the city’s ability to respond effectively to growth-related issues like housing affordability, homelessness, mobility and public safety

Name: Kara Ceriello
Summary: Kara Ceriello is a former president and director of the Wallingford Chamber of Commerce. She owned a cards and gifts store in Wallingford for many years.
Committee: Senior issues, Human Services or Housing
Problem: The 1% versus the 99%, overdevelopment, homelessness, leaders who don't seem to pay much attention to the growing problems of regular people and the great need to tax the wealthy and corporations

Name: Kate Martin
Summary: Kate Martin ran for mayor in 2013 but didn't advance past the primary. She pushed to save part of the Alaskan Way Viaduct for an elevated park.
Problem: We prioritize the next cocktail instead of the next generation.

Name: Melissa Hall
Summary: Melissa Hall is a self-employed attorney and a self-described "land-use geek" who wants to see Seattle become more dense and urban.

Name: Sergio Garcia
Summary: Sergio Garcia is a Seattle police officer who's worked in Ballard. He spoke out for a new police-union contract.
Vmoney: Ballard Inn, Ballard Hotel, Olympic Gym Ballard, Savior Faire an Eco Conscious, Space Oddity, NW Market Shoes, Stoneburner, Bastille, Sweet Mickey’s Candy Store, Bongos Caribbean Restaurant, Tides and Pines, Noble Fir, Hattie’s Hat, Sunset Tavern

Name: Terry Rice
Summary: Terry Rice is the managing director of Savor Seattle, a food-tour company. He says he understands the needs of small-business owners.
